channel.title: Not getting IP banned
channel.description:
I'm a little concerned about IP banned from rs. I really don't care that much about my accounts anymore, but I'm not the only person who plays on this computer. I've searched the forums and found out that a proxy maybe isn't enough to fool the actual rs client.
So what can I do?

item.title: Not getting IP banned
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

i think the new gfx update with runescape killed most clients. Im pretty sure. If im not mistaken, people need to get a successful cache (or is it deob...) before any more clients can be made.

They updated the whole engine, changed it in quite a few ways.

The reason you don’t see lot’s of “Current” of clients floating around is because not many people can solve the obfuscation on the new engine. Let’s say your smart enough deobfuscate the latest client (bcel and javassist for ze win!), now you have to get the client to connect to the server, which the new engine makes extremely difficult. Let’s say you managed to get it to connect to the server. Now you have to fix the many traps in place to detect the fact that your not playing on a legit client. As soon as Jagex updates the client, all your work is gone.

So what do we, the cheating community, need? A deobfuscator and updater to give us a fresh new connection ready client after every Jagex update.

Read full topic

item.title: Not getting IP banned
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Well neither of those two things are difficult to get, so that’s not the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Not getting IP banned
item.dc:creator: @wonko wonko
item.description:
@wonko wrote:

I see. Good to know its not something I have to worry about too much. Has anyone made a good client with a UID changing feature?

Thanks for the replies by the way

Read full topic

item.title: Not getting IP banned
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

PaulT:

Given that Jagex won’t IP ban you unless you give minors links to midget goat sex websites, or something, you will be fine.

We must think of the children! I’ll write a RS spambotnet immediately…

Read full topic

item.title: Not getting IP banned
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

The Runescape Client generates a UID for your computer when you log on. It’s like a little tag so Jagex can ban all your characters. You can edit the client so you can have your a random UID, hence stopping Jagex from identifying you beyond the current character your using.

I’ve seen Jagex IP ban before, but very rarely. I’ve only seen it happen once out of hundreds of cheaters.

As far as using a proxy to hide your IP from Jagex, it has worked in the past, I don’t know if it still does.

Given that Jagex won’t IP ban you unless you give minors links to midget goat sex websites, or something, you will be fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Not getting IP banned
item.dc:creator: @wonko wonko
item.description:
@wonko wrote:

No one here has gotten all their accounts banned? Maybe they are bluffing.

Also: I was reading the little black book and and PaulT said you could get around it by using a proxy (which you can’t) but he also said something about fixing your user id number (UID). Could someone tell me what that means?

Read full topic

item.title: Not getting IP banned
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

There is code in the client to display a message saying “This computers address has been banned”. No idea if they’ve ever actually used it or if it’s a scare tactic, I’m guessing the latter.

Read full topic

item.title: Not getting IP banned
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

oh… im pretty sure what their talking about is how they monitor unfair trades now. so if you keep making like a 500k coal trade to your main, it’ll be a bit suspicios and jagex will then ban you both

Read full topic

item.title: Not getting IP banned
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

dont worry. at all
runescape doesnt ip ban and i personally dont think they ever will. It doesnt sound right, and plus, there are many shared computers out there so i dont think they really want to. If they did, people would just use another computer or change their ip. it doesnt make sense.
but i may be wrong… they may have changed policies i am not aware of.

Read full topic
